title.justification: The title provided in the paper.

extractions.description: This paper presents a model for games among teams where each team consists of a homogeneous population of cooperative agents that compete with other teams. The authors propose a refinement of the Team-Nash equilibrium called mean-field Markov perfect equilibrium (MF-MPE) and demonstrate an approximation for large numbers of players.

type.justification: The paper provides theoretical refinements and solutions to a game theory model.
type.quote: we propose a mean-field based refinement of the Team-Nash equilibrium of the game, which we call mean-field Markov perfect equilibrium (MF-MPE)

name.justification: The study focuses on theoretical concepts related to games among teams.
name.quote: we propose a mean-field based refinement of the Team-Nash equilibrium of the game, which we call mean-field Markov perfect equilibrium (MF-MPE)

name.justification: The research involves dynamic programming and control mechanisms within game theory.
name.quote: We identify a dynamic programming decomposition to characterize MF-MPE

name.justification: The paper involves optimization concepts to reach the equilibrium states.
name.quote: each team is interested in minimizing the total expected cost incurred over a finite horizon
